DataElement.preferredDefinition: Mailing Address of the institution where the equipment is located.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the location at which an organization can be reached.  (manualloy-curated)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

Concepts.definition: A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research as, a literary institution; also, a building or the buildings occupied or used by such organization.:The location at which an organization or person can be reached. (from American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/24/009 Equipment CUI changed per EVS direction10/5/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  9/12/07  DEC created to support DICOM task utilizing IE & DICOM Attribute terms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: ST:  DICOM Short Text; A character string that may contain one or more paragraphs. It may contain the Graphic Character set and the Control Characters, CR, LF, FF, and ESC. Data Elements with this DICOM Value Representation shall not be multi-valued

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/21/07 - released for curation of NCIA DEs. 5/31/07-Create for CDEs using the DICOM Date format; based on 2007 DICOM Standard, section 3.
